feat.@value: Letter of Shenoute
Abraham our father wished to have children with Sarah.
And Sarah wished to have children with Abraham.
And thus the Lord God gave a child to Abraham in his old age,
begetting Isaac with Sarah in her old age.
They had him, their child beloved like a myriad of children, being one . . .
Neither . . . is . . . after his . .
which came from his part.
And thus he gives rest to the mother who bore him
and in this way he inherited the inheritance of his ancestors
according to that which was said to Abraham through God
'That one who is Ishmael, he will not receive inheritance from you
but I will bless him on your account
and I will glorify him greatly
and make him a great nation which is numerous
and those who come from your [...]
Isaac [it is he alone who will inher]it from you.'
Therefore indeed she spoke boldly in the knowledge of God
namely, the mother of the child whom she had borne,
'Cast out this slave with her child.
For the child of this slave will not inherit along with my child, Isaac.'
Isaac prayed to the Lord, wishing that he would have children with Rebecca
and Rebecca also wished that she would have children with Isaac,
and thus the Lord God gave to them according to their heart,
filling all their requests,
and Esau and Jacob were born.
And Isaac blessed Jacob through God by the design of Rebecca, the mother of Jacob,
while Esau became a servant to Jacob, according to the Scriptures,
‘The great will serve the lesser.’
And also, ‘Jacob, I loved.  But Esau, I hated.’
And Jacob wished that he would have children with Rachel,
as he had with Leah,
and as he had with Zelpha and Balla.
And Rachel wished that she would have children with Jacob.
And she grieved,
and found fault with Jacob in her ignorance,
in the abundance of [her] grief,
‘Give me children, or I will die.’
And Jacob, who was discouraged, said to her,
‘Am I myself the Lord who robs the fruit from you[r womb]?’
And Jacob said these things angrily because he also wished to have children with Rachel.
And thus God saw their grief,
and so he gave children to Jacob by Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.
And Jacob blessed all his children through the Lord God,
he who blessed Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and the children.
